finding.problemType: Cryptography: Check that only allowed crypto algorithms are used
finding.description:
An identified location for problem type 'Cryptography: Check that only allowed crypto algorithms are used'. The protocol check detected something wrong when encountering symbol 'AnyAlgorithm_SecretKeyFactoryGetInstance'.
Violated protocol: Check Allowed Cryptography Algorithms Protocol description: Allow only a given set of cryptography algorithm names where algorithm names are expected.
The algorithm names are configured via constant value constraint variables.
Names to be checked against can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html
Matching pattern in protocol check kind 'AnyAlgorithm_SecretKeyFactoryGetInstance': static javax.crypto.SecretKeyFactory javax.crypto.SecretKeyFactory.getInstance(java.lang.String, ***)

finding.problemType: Cryptography: Check that only allowed crypto algorithms are used
finding.description:

The algorithm names are configured via constant value constraint variables.

Matching pattern in protocol check kind 'AnyAlgorithm_CipherConstruction': static javax.crypto.Cipher javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance(java.lang.String, ***)

An identified location for problem type 'Cryptography: Password-Based Encryption'. Spec being used is not ready for use.
Violated protocol: Creation and use of a PBE Cipher Protocol description: Creation of a cipher for PBE consists of creating an uninitialized cipher, and then initializing it properly.
